vstore.framework.node

Class NodeInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • vstore.framework.node.NodeInfo
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class NodeInfo
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class holds information about one single storage node. It contains the address, the port, the latitude and longitude of the storage node as well as the login credentials.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • NodeInfo

        public NodeInfo(java.lang.String uuid,
                java.lang.String address,
                int port,
                NodeType type,
                VLatLng latlng)
        Constructs a new NodeInfo object.
        Parameters:
        uuid - The UUID of the storage node
        address - The ip address or domain name of the storage node.
        port - The port number the storage node server runs on
        type - The type of the node, for available types see NodeType
        latlng - The geographical location (latitude and longitude) of the node. See VLatLng

      • NodeInfo

        public NodeInfo(org.json.simple.JSONObject node)
        Tries to construct a new NodeInfo object from the given JSON object
        Parameters:
        node - The json object which describes the node info.

    • Method Detail

      • getIdentifier

        public java.lang.String getIdentifier()
        Returns:
        The id of the storage node.

      • getAddress

        public java.lang.String getAddress()
        Returns:
        The address of the storage node

      • getPort

        public int getPort()
        Returns:
        The port of the storage node

      • getLatLng

        public VLatLng getLatLng()
        Returns:
        The location of the storage node (see VLatLng)

      • getNodeType

        public NodeType getNodeType()
        Returns:
        The type of the node (see NodeType)

      • getBandwidthUp

        public int getBandwidthUp()
        Returns:
        The upstream bandwidth of the node in MBit/s.

      • getBandwidthDown

        public int getBandwidthDown()
        Returns:
        The downstream bandwidth of the node in MBit/s.

      • getBaseUri

        public java.lang.String getBaseUri()
        Returns:
        The base uri of this node, consisting of address and port.

      • getUUIDUri

        public java.lang.String getUUIDUri()
        Returns:
        The uri that has to be used to get the UUID of this node. The node will reply with its meta information if you send an HTTP GET request to this uri.

      • getUploadUri

        public java.lang.String getUploadUri()
        Returns:
        The uri that has to be used to upload a file to the node. Upload a file by sending a multipart POST request to this address consisting of the following fields: fileinfo originalname context mimetype extension isPrivate phoneID

      • getDownloadUri

        public java.lang.String getDownloadUri(java.lang.String uuid,
                                       java.lang.String phoneID)
        Parameters:
        uuid - The UUID of the file
        phoneID - The phone ID of the phone (see IdentifierUtils.getDeviceIdentifier() ()}).
        Returns:
        The uri that has to be used to download a file from the node. Download a file by sending an HTTP GET request to this uri. If the file is private, the node will only reply with the file if you are the owner.

      • getDeleteUri

        public java.lang.String getDeleteUri(java.lang.String uuid,
                                     java.lang.String phoneID)
        Parameters:
        uuid - The UUID of the file
        phoneID - The phone ID of the phone (see IdentifierUtils.getDeviceIdentifier() ()}).
        Returns:
        The uri that has to be used to delete a file from the node. You can only delete files that you are the owner of (e.g. that matches your phone ID). To delete a file, send an HTTP DELETE request to this uri.

      • getThumbnailUri

        public java.lang.String getThumbnailUri(java.lang.String uuid,
                                        java.lang.String phoneID)
        Parameters:
        uuid - The UUID of the file
        phoneID - The phone ID of the phone (see IdentifierUtils.getDeviceIdentifier() ()}).
        Returns:
        The uri that has to be used to download a thumbnail for a file from the node. Download a thumbnail by sending an HTTP GET request to this uri. If the file is private, the node will only reply with a thumbnail if you are the owner.

      • getMimeTypeUri

        public java.lang.String getMimeTypeUri(java.lang.String uuid,
                                       java.lang.String phoneID)
        Parameters:
        uuid - The UUID of the file
        phoneID - The phone ID of the phone (see IdentifierUtils.getDeviceIdentifier() ()}).
        Returns:
        The uri that has to be used to fetch the mimetype for a file from this node. To get the mimetype information, send an HTTP GET request to this uri. If the file is private, the node will only reply with the mimetype if you are the owner.

      • getMetadataUri

        public java.lang.String getMetadataUri(java.lang.String uuid,
                                       java.lang.String phoneID,
                                       boolean fullMetadata)
        Parameters:
        uuid - The UUID of the file
        phoneID - The phone ID of the phone (see IdentifierUtils.getDeviceIdentifier() ()}).
        fullMetadata - If set to true, the uri for requesting full metadata is returned (e.g. with context information). If set to false, the uri for requesting lightweight metadata is returned.
        Returns:
        The uri that has to be used to fetch metadata for a file from this node. To get the metadata, send an HTTP GET request to this uri. If the file is private, the node will only reply with the metadata if you are the owner.

      • setUUID

        Sets the id for this node.
        Parameters:
        uuid - The id to set for this node.

      • getGeographicDistanceTo

        public float getGeographicDistanceTo(VLatLng latlng)
        Returns the distance of the given location to the node in kilometers.
        Parameters:
        latlng - The location
        Returns:
        The distance. Float.MAX_VALUE if node has no location.
